thread.title: Manipur Election Results shocker: Only 90 people voted for 'Iron Lady' Irom Sharmila!
thread.title_full: Manipur Election Results shocker: Only 90 people voted for 'Iron Lady' Irom Sharmila!

title: Manipur Election Results shocker: Only 90 people voted for 'Iron Lady' Irom Sharmila!
text:
Even NOTA got more votes than Sharmila 2 Big question mark on political future of Sharmila 3 Okram Ibobi Singh got 18,649 votes in his favour 
Famous human rights activist, who turned to politics last year after ending her world's longest hunger strike which ran for 16 years, proved to be a disaster in Manipur elections after the results were announced on Saturday. 
Shockingly only a handful of 90 people voted in her favour from Thoubal constituency while her main opponent and Chief Minister Okram Ibobi Singh got 18,649 votes. 
Even the NOTA (None of the Above) option got 143 votes, much more than what Sharmila got. 
The real threat to Singh was BJP whose candidate Leitanthem Basanta Singh polled 8179 votes. 
The results put a big question mark on the political relevance of the anti-AFSPA activist Sharmila. 
Her party PRJA (Peoples' Resurgence and Justice Alliance) had put up candidates for three seats. Sharmila has got support from the Left Democratic Front (LDF) comprising six parties including CPI, CPIM, JDU and AAP. 
"We have lost a battle in the long war, but we have started the fire, initiated a movement which will continue. Thanks all for the support," PRJA said on Twitter. 
The Meira Paibis (women activists) who had been Sharmila's backbone during her agitation against the 'draconian' Armed Forces Special Powers Act went against her once she announced entry into politics. 
Even during campaigning, Sharmila looked alone with a bicycle and a whistle (party's symbol).
